oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from R.L. Hooper to Co. Matthew Erwine
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: R. L. Hooper correspondence to Co. Matthew Erwine, June 7, 1777.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutions; Correspondence
United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783; Letters
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Robert Lettis Hooper Hooper settled in Northampton County, Pennsylvania, and was a deputy quartermaster-general during the Revolutionary War. His department covered three counties in Pennsylvania, and the county of Sussex in New Jersey.
After the war, Hooper became an ironmaster and was much involved with the mining industry. He became deeply interested in the Ringwood Iron Works, in Bergen County.
